search_query: Manhattan Associates supply chain WMS competitors 2000

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Major ERP and supply chain software provider with warehouse logistics solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software provider with warehouse management capabilities

competitors.name: i2 Technologies
competitors.notes: Supply chain planning and optimization software (later acquired by JDA in 2010)

competitors.name: RedPrairie
competitors.notes: WMS and supply chain execution software provider

context: In the early 2000s, the WMS market was dominated by large ERP vendors like SAP and Oracle, along with specialized supply chain software providers. Manhattan Associates was emerging as a key player in warehouse management systems. The market was characterized by on-premise software solutions, and Manhattan was competing against both enterprise resource planning vendors extending into logistics and dedicated supply chain software companies. Historical data from this period is limited, but major players included SAP, Oracle, i2 Technologies, and RedPrairie.
